title: 114_hr5879
content: MODIFICATIONS OF CREDIT FOR PRODUCTION FROM ADVANCED NUCLEAR POWER FACILITIES. The amendment to Section 45J(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes the allocation of unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. This allocation is first given to facilities placed in service before that date that did not receive a full nameplate capacity allocation, and then to facilities placed in service after that date. The unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation is the excess of 6,000 megawatts over the aggregate amount allocated by the Secretary before January 1, 2021, reduced by any amount allocated to a facility not placed in service before that date. The amendment allows for the transfer of credits by certain public entities under Section 45J of the Code. The new subsection allows qualified public entities to transfer credits under Section 45J of the Code to eligible project partners. The eligible project partner will be treated as the taxpayer for the credit if the qualified public entity elects to transfer the credit. The new subsection allows public entities to transfer credits under Section 45J of the Code to eligible project partners, who will be treated as the taxpayer for the credit if the entity elects to transfer it. Public entity includes government entities, mutual or cooperative electric companies, and not-for-profit electric utilities that received a loan under the Rural Electrification Act of 1936. Eligible project partners are individuals involved in designing or constructing advanced nuclear power facilities. The subsection allows public entities to transfer credits under Section 45J of the Code to eligible project partners involved in designing or constructing advanced nuclear power facilities. This includes individuals providing the nuclear steam supply system, nuclear fuel, or having an ownership interest in the facility. Special rules apply to partnerships for determining the credit under subsection (a). The subsection allows public entities to transfer credits under Section 45J of the Code to eligible project partners involved in designing or constructing advanced nuclear power facilities. Partnerships have special rules for determining the credit at the partnership level. Eligible project partners can take the credit in the first taxable year ending with or after their involvement in the project. The subsection allows public entities to transfer credits under Section 45J of the Code to eligible project partners involved in designing or constructing advanced nuclear power facilities. Partnerships have special rules for determining the credit at the partnership level. Eligible project partners can take the credit in the first taxable year ending with or after their involvement in the project. Additionally, any benefit derived by an eligible project partner in connection with an election under this subsection shall not be considered as a private business use for purposes of section 141(b)(1). The amendment in subsection (a) allows income related to an election under section 45J(e)(1) to be treated as funds collected from members for meeting losses and expenses. The effective dates are the date of enactment for unutilized limitation amounts and taxable years beginning after December 31, 2016 for transfer of credit by certain public entities.
